history.content:
Shewchuck's with EE127 is highly preferable. 
----

+1 shewchuk's is the best class I've ever taken, the homeworks are more real world and hands on than basically anything else I've encountered at Berkeley and it's been so worthwhile, rewarding, and fun. am also taking with 127 and while the two problem sets clash in a nasty way (wednesday and thursday deadlines) the subject matter pairs up nicely

I'm a rising senior and I am really interested in a job in ML/DS. I'm wondering whether it is better to take 189 in the Fall or Spring. 

I've heard that Fall (with Listgarden/Yu) is much more theoretical/mathematical. I'm okay with that but I am questioning how much practical work I will experience in that class. This is in contrast to Shewchuck's very practical 189. I would take Shewchuck's version as it seems to be the more liked and practical option but since recruiting is in the Fall, I feel like I really need 189 to be competitive for DS/ML roles.

In regards to my coursework, schedule, experience:

I've take DS100, EE126, CS186, CS170, EE225B (image processing), and all the lower divs. I'm planning on taking EE127 next semester. I'm also wondering if this coursework will make me competitive for DS/ML roles.

I'm also currently working in a non-EECS lab as a data scientist and have been working here for 3 sems now.

My question is, should I take the class in Fall (to be competitive in recruiting even though the class feels less practical) or in the Spring (more practical version but may be too late)?
history.subject: When to take 189 for Career in DS/ML
